member.summary: A recurrence definition describing how time window recurs

member.summary: The recurrence pattern specifying how often the time window repeats

member.summary: The recurrence range specifying how long the recurrence pattern repeats

member.name: M:Microsoft.FeatureManagement.FeatureFilters.RecurrenceEvaluator.IsMatch(System.DateTimeOffset,Microsoft.FeatureManagement.FeatureFilters.TimeWindowFilterSettings)
member.summary: Checks if a provided timestamp is within any recurring time window specified by the Recurrence section in the time window filter settings. If the time window filter has an invalid recurrence setting, an exception will be thrown. A datetime. The settings of time window filter. True if the timestamp is within any recurring time window, false otherwise.

member.name: M:Microsoft.FeatureManagement.FeatureFilters.RecurrenceEvaluator.CalculateClosestStart(System.DateTimeOffset,Microsoft.FeatureManagement.FeatureFilters.TimeWindowFilterSettings)
member.summary: Calculates the start time of the closest active time window. A datetime. The settings of time window filter. The start time of the closest active time window or null if the recurrence range surpasses its end.

member.name: M:Microsoft.FeatureManagement.FeatureFilters.RecurrenceEvaluator.CalculateSurroundingOccurrences(System.DateTimeOffset,Microsoft.FeatureManagement.FeatureFilters.TimeWindowFilterSettings,System.Nullable{System.DateTimeOffset}@,System.Nullable{System.DateTimeOffset}@)
member.summary: Calculates the closest previous recurrence occurrence (if any) before the given time and the next occurrence (if any) after it. A datetime. The settings of time window filter. The closest previous occurrence. Note that prev occurrence can be null even if the time is past the start date, because the recurrence range may have surpassed its end. The next occurrence. Note that next occurrence can be null even if the prev occurrence is not null, because the recurrence range may have reached its end.

member.name: M:Microsoft.FeatureManagement.FeatureFilters.RecurrenceEvaluator.TryFindPreviousOccurrence(System.DateTimeOffset,Microsoft.FeatureManagement.FeatureFilters.TimeWindowFilterSettings,System.DateTimeOffset@,System.Int32@)
member.summary: Finds the closest previous recurrence occurrence before the given time according to the recurrence pattern. The given time should be later than the recurrence start. A return value indicates whether any previous occurrence can be found. A datetime. The settings of time window filter. The closest previous occurrence. The number of occurrences between the time and the recurrence start. True if the closest previous occurrence is within the recurrence range, false otherwise.

member.name: M:Microsoft.FeatureManagement.FeatureFilters.RecurrenceEvaluator.FindDailyPreviousOccurrence(System.DateTimeOffset,Microsoft.FeatureManagement.FeatureFilters.TimeWindowFilterSettings,System.DateTimeOffset@,System.Int32@)
member.summary: Finds the closest previous recurrence occurrence before the given time according to the "Daily" recurrence pattern. The given time should be later than the recurrence start. A datetime. The settings of time window filter. The closest previous occurrence. The number of occurrences between the time and the recurrence start.

member.name: M:Microsoft.FeatureManagement.FeatureFilters.RecurrenceEvaluator.FindWeeklyPreviousOccurrence(System.DateTimeOffset,Microsoft.FeatureManagement.FeatureFilters.TimeWindowFilterSettings,System.DateTimeOffset@,System.Int32@)
member.summary: Finds the closest previous recurrence occurrence before the given time according to the "Weekly" recurrence pattern. The given time should be later than the recurrence start. A datetime. The settings of time window filter. The closest previous occurrence. The number of occurrences between the time and the recurrence start.

member.name: M:Microsoft.FeatureManagement.FeatureFilters.RecurrenceEvaluator.CalculateWeeklyNextOccurrence(System.DateTimeOffset,Microsoft.FeatureManagement.FeatureFilters.TimeWindowFilterSettings)
member.summary: Finds the next recurrence occurrence after the provided previous occurrence according to the "Weekly" recurrence pattern. The previous occurrence. The settings of time window filter.

member.summary: Calculates the offset in days between two given days of the week. A day of week. A day of week. The number of days to be added to day2 to reach day1

member.summary: The recurrence pattern describes the frequency by which the time window repeats.

member.summary: The recurrence pattern type.

member.name: P:Microsoft.FeatureManagement.FeatureFilters.RecurrencePattern.Interval
member.summary: The number of units between occurrences, where units can be in days or weeks, depending on the pattern type.

member.name: P:Microsoft.FeatureManagement.FeatureFilters.RecurrencePattern.DaysOfWeek
member.summary: The days of the week on which the time window occurs. This property is only applicable for weekly pattern.

member.name: P:Microsoft.FeatureManagement.FeatureFilters.RecurrencePattern.FirstDayOfWeek
member.summary: The first day of the week. This property is only applicable for weekly pattern.

member.name: T:Microsoft.FeatureManagement.FeatureFilters.RecurrencePatternType
member.summary: The type of specifying the frequency by which the time window repeats.

member.name: F:Microsoft.FeatureManagement.FeatureFilters.RecurrencePatternType.Daily
member.summary: The pattern where the time window will repeat based on the number of days specified by interval between occurrences.

member.name: F:Microsoft.FeatureManagement.FeatureFilters.RecurrencePatternType.Weekly
member.summary: The pattern where the time window will repeat on the same day or days of the week, based on the number of weeks between each set of occurrences.

member.summary: The recurrence range type.

member.summary: The number of times to repeat the time window.

member.summary: The type of specifying the date range over which the time window repeats.

member.name: F:Microsoft.FeatureManagement.FeatureFilters.RecurrenceRangeType.NoEnd
member.summary: The time window repeats on all the days that fit the corresponding .

member.name: F:Microsoft.FeatureManagement.FeatureFilters.RecurrenceRangeType.EndDate
member.summary: The time window repeats on all the days that fit the corresponding before or on the end date specified in EndDate of .

member.name: F:Microsoft.FeatureManagement.FeatureFilters.RecurrenceRangeType.Numbered
member.summary: The time window repeats for the number specified in the NumberOfOccurrences of that fit based on the .

member.summary: The application memory cache to store the start time of the closest active time window. By caching this time, the time window can minimize redundant computations when evaluating recurrence.

member.summary: This property allows the time window filter in our test suite to use simulated time.

member.summary: The settings that are used to configure the feature filter.

member.name: P:Microsoft.FeatureManagement.FeatureFilters.TimeWindowFilterSettings.Start
member.summary: An optional start time used to determine when a feature configured to use the feature filter should be enabled. If no start time is specified the time window is considered to have already started.

member.name: P:Microsoft.FeatureManagement.FeatureFilters.TimeWindowFilterSettings.End
member.summary: An optional end time used to determine when a feature configured to use the feature filter should be enabled. If no end time is specified the time window is considered to never end.

member.name: P:Microsoft.FeatureManagement.FeatureFilters.TimeWindowFilterSettings.Recurrence
member.summary: Add-on recurrence rule allows the time window defined by Start and End to recur. The rule specifies both how often the time window repeats and for how long.

member.summary: Options that control the behavior of the feature management system.

member.name: P:Microsoft.FeatureManagement.FeatureManagementOptions.IgnoreMissingFeatureFilters
member.summary: Controls the behavior of feature evaluation when dependent feature filters are missing. If missing feature filters are not ignored an exception will be thrown when attempting to evaluate a feature that depends on a missing feature filter. This option is invalid when used in combination with The default value is false.

member.name: P:Microsoft.FeatureManagement.FeatureManagementOptions.IgnoreMissingFeatures
member.summary: Controls the behavior of feature evaluation when the target feature is missing. If missing features are not ignored an exception will be thrown when attempting to evaluate them. The default value is true.

member.name: T:Microsoft.FeatureManagement.IContextualFeatureFilter`1
member.summary: A filter that can be used to determine whether some criteria is met to enable a feature. A feature filter is free to use any criteria available, such as process state or request content. Feature filters can be registered for a given feature and if any feature filter evaluates to true, that feature will be considered enabled. A contextual feature filter can take advantage of contextual data passed in from callers of the feature management system. A contextual feature filter will only be executed if a context that is assignable from TContext is available.

member.name: M:Microsoft.FeatureManagement.IContextualFeatureFilter`1.EvaluateAsync(Microsoft.FeatureManagement.FeatureFilterEvaluationContext,`0)
member.summary: Evaluates the feature filter to see if the filter's criteria for being enabled has been satisfied.
member.param: A feature filter evaluation context that contains information that may be needed to evaluate the filter. This context includes configuration, if any, for this filter for the feature being evaluated.
A context defined by the application that is passed in to the feature management system to provide contextual information for evaluating a feature's state.
member.returns: True if the filter's criteria has been met, false otherwise.

member.summary: The reason the variant was assigned during the evaluation of a feature.

member.name: F:Microsoft.FeatureManagement.Telemetry.VariantAssignmentReason.None
member.summary: Variant allocation did not happen. No variant is assigned.

member.name: F:Microsoft.FeatureManagement.Telemetry.VariantAssignmentReason.DefaultWhenDisabled
member.summary: The default variant is assigned when a feature flag is disabled.

member.name: F:Microsoft.FeatureManagement.Telemetry.VariantAssignmentReason.DefaultWhenEnabled
member.summary: The default variant is assigned because of no applicable user/group/percentile allocation when a feature flag is enabled.

member.name: F:Microsoft.FeatureManagement.Telemetry.VariantAssignmentReason.User
member.summary: The variant is assigned because of the user allocation when a feature flag is enabled.

member.name: F:Microsoft.FeatureManagement.Telemetry.VariantAssignmentReason.Group
member.summary: The variant is assigned because of the group allocation when a feature flag is enabled.

member.name: F:Microsoft.FeatureManagement.Telemetry.VariantAssignmentReason.Percentile
member.summary: The variant is assigned because of the percentile allocation when a feature flag is enabled.
